Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements about composite controls are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: Composite controls are used for creating custom graphical interfaces.
Composite controls are reused across multiple applications.
Composite controls are created only as a part of the Windows Application project.
Composite controls contain only one Windows Forms control in a container.
Composite controls cannot be inherited from other controls.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selection is: (A)-(True), (B)-(True), (C)-(False), (D)-(False), and (E)-(False).
